spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout roughly matches (Kitchen/Dining left, Living central, Bedroom 1 top/right, Hall central, Laundry bottom-left, main Bathroom bottom-center/right). However, the right-side secondary room is represented/labeled as a bathroom instead of Bedroom 2, and the living room appears shrunk vs the 2D plan (area shown 228 vs 245). Several exterior window locations/sizes do not match the 2D plan (render uses large floor-to-ceiling/window groupings where the plan indicates smaller/standard windows). Entry/porch massing alters the perceived entry-door location.

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness and general enclosure are consistent, and most doors appear embedded in walls. Core adjacencies mostly hold (Hall connects to Laundry/Closets/Bath/Bedroom 1). Major fidelity failure: Bedroom 2 is not correctly realized; a second bathroom is introduced/indicated instead. This counts as both a missing-room and hallucinated-room issue under strict verification.

furniture_mapping.notes: Kitchen, dining table, and living seating generally correspond to the plan. Bathroom fixtures are present. Secondary right-side room furniture does not clearly match the intended Bedroom 2 program due to the bathroom/bedroom mismatch, reducing mapping accuracy. Furniture scale is mostly consistent but simplified.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean isometric presentation with good lighting and readable composition. Minor issues: not strictly orthographic/isometric (visible perspective), and some geometry/window extrusions feel stylized rather than plan-faithful.

detected_errors.description: Bedroom 2 (bottom-right in 2D plan) is not correctly represented as a bedroom in the 3D render.
A second bathroom is introduced/indicated on the right side (labeled 'Bathroom 2 126 sq ft'), which does not exist in the 2D plan.
Living Room proportions/area appear reduced in the 3D (render shows 228 sq ft vs 245 sq ft in the 2D plan), indicating room-size distortion.

Window placement/scale is inconsistent: the 3D uses large floor-to-ceiling window groups (notably on the right and lower exterior walls) that do not match the smaller/standard window pattern shown in the 2D plan.
Entry massing/vestibule in the 3D alters the apparent location/geometry of the main entry compared to the simple 2D threshold, affecting door placement fidelity.
